title: "I love my boys": Jose Mourinho pays heartfelt message to Manchester United players - and Sir Alex Ferguson
text:

Jose Mourinho has declared his "love" for his Manchester United players before their clash with Bournemouth. United bagged the first trophy of the Mourinho era with last weekend's EFL Cup win over Southampton at Wembley, with a Mourinho paying a heartfelt tribute to his players. Writing in his programme notes, Mourinho said: "I love my boys. What an amazing group of players and people they are. Wayne Rooney returned to United's starting XI against Bournemouth (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Mourinho is still smiling from United's EFL Cup success (Photo: AMA/Getty) United's players will be hoping to celebrate more success before the season is over (Photo: MUFC/TWITTER) 
"You just have to look at the little details from last Sunday's win over Southampton to see how special they are: Wayne Rooney jumping around with mad joy when Zlatan scored the winning goal. 
"Marouane Fellaini's desire to help us finish the job when he came in for the final minutes; the happiness of Bastian Schweinsteiger and the other player who weren't in the squad but were part of the celebrations. 
"These little details are of maximum value to me and they remind me why I love these boys. It was also great to see Sir Alex Ferguson enjoying the celebrations so much: he is Manchester United!" poll loading Will Manchester United bag a cup treble this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
